I just wanted to send a quick note and introduce myself.  I've been
following NEAT since grad school and have just started recently working
with it again.  I'm working on what may the overly-zealous project to
create a "pokerbot" based on NEAT.  I've started by essentially rewriting
the neat engine itself in the hopes of speeding things up a bit.  I'm
anticipating the preprocessing and gameplay of poker itself to dominate
the cost of this endeavor and so, to the degree possible, I sort of need
NEAT to get out of the way (process wise!).  Thus far I've completed the
network and most of the selection process.  I've taken a very small bite
out of the actual poker side of things and am leaning heavily on the
poker-eval library (see sourceforge) for this.  I'll post code somewhere
pretty soon if anyone is interested.  I'd especially like to hear from
anyone with an in-depth understanding of complex equities in poker! 
Anyway, greetings.

- jeff
